etymologies: mid 17th century (in an earlier sense). Partly (i) from (a) French alcoolisation (1628 or earlier as †alcoholisation in the obsolete sense ‘pulverization’; also †alkoholisation; now chiefly in senses ‘development of properties characteristic to alcohol’, ‘action of mixing (a liquid) with alcohol’)

definitions: The action or process of mixing or becoming saturated with alcohol; the formation of alcohol (ethanol) by fermentation.
Subjection to the effects of alcohol or alcoholic drink.
